basics.name: Daniel Kathein
basics.label: AI & Software Development Enthusiast
basics.summary: AI undergraduate student at Carnegie Mellon University (School of Computer Science), passionate about ML research, large language models, and full-stack development

work.name: NVIDIA
work.position: Incoming Deep Learning Infrastructure Engineer Intern
work.summary: Will contribute to Deep Learning and large-scale ML efforts within VLSI design.

work.name: CMU Language Technologies Institute, Li Lab
work.summary: Conducted research on large language models.
highlights: Fine-tuned 3 base LLMs for code generation, using a self-align pipeline for autonomous data generation and learning.
Pioneered a novel non-greedy tokenization technique, leveraging beam search to achieve lowest perplexity segmentations.
Developed a 10,000-sample benchmark to rigorously evaluate LLMs on complex linguistic and string manipulation tasks.
Achieved a notable performance improvement when applied to the Llama-3.1-Instruct model.

work.name: CMUCal (ScottyLabs)
work.summary: Building a comprehensive academic resource centralization platform for CMU students.
highlights: Engineered CMUCal, a comprehensive academic platform automating the integration of essential student resources.
Led the design of CMUCal's backend using Python, Node, and MongoDB, with front-end development in React.
Integrated 15+ data sources via advanced web scraping and AI-driven crowd-sourcing, centralizing academic resources.
Streamlined the seamless sync of office hours and tutoring into student calendars, reducing manual entry by 80%.

work.name: Freelance
work.summary: Built full-stack solutions for e-commerce monitoring and other custom software needs.
highlights: Coded Python software to monitor e-commerce in real-time on 15+ retailer sites and alert product availability.
Architected a robust multithreaded, proxy-supported web harvesting infrastructure using BeautifulSoup and Selenium.
Facilitated $400K+ in generated revenue for Amazon, Walmart, and other online sellers from 1500+ total users.

volunteer.summary: Coordinated code-a-thons, workshops, and mentored competitive programming teams.
highlights: Coordinated code-a-thons, workshops, and guest speaker events (e.g., Google) for 100+ club members.
Led and coached highly competitive teams for 5+ major contests including ACSL, PClassic, and UCF HSPT.
Awarded 1st place at the Winter Code-a-thon, emphasizing data structures and algorithms, among 20+ teams.

awards.title: Achievement Award
awards.summary: Top 1% of class in Computer Science & Math

projects.name: Multi-Camera Association with Transformers
projects.description: Conducted 325+ hours of research at the University of Florida under Dr. Henry Medeiros, designing a cutting-edge multi-camera tracking algorithm with Local Feature Transformer; performed large experiments tuning 8 parameters.
highlights: Contributed to the US Department of Homeland Security'â€™'s CLASP initiative, aimed at enhancing airport safety.

Presented at the 2022 International Forum on Research Excellence and 2023 Florida JSEHS Symposium competition, securing 4th place overall and the Regional Recognition Award among the top 6 speakers (research publication: https://arxiv.org/abs/2408.09295).
Granted 1st place in Intelligent Machines, Robotics, and Systems Software at the Broward Science and Engineering Fair.

projects.name: Epileptic Seizure Prediction with Long Short-Term Memory
projects.description: Developed advanced RNN, LSTM, and GRU models for high-accuracy epileptic seizure detection from EEG data.
highlights: Implemented SMOTE for data balancing and Keras Tuner for optimization, achieving a record 97.5% accuracy.
